label: 悪党
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Literally, evil bands." Lawless groups of minor warriors and, at times, peasants who banded together to seize tax rice and commit other acts of banditry. They became especially prevalent after the mid-thirteenth century and are known to have acted with or under the direction of other warriors, including military estate steward (jitō), who challenged the political order of the Kamakura and Nambokuchō periods.　[地頭]　"
